dialogue: I don't even know what to say.
Talk about being arrested. Eliana, too.
Gilda called again today. She managed to get Vera on the waiting list for a flight next week.
I think it'd be better if she stayed a while longer. Do you know how much the ticket is?
I'll work it out with Rubens. He'd better come back soon, to deal with this mess.
Son of a bitch.
Do you mind? I'll buy him another.
You sure you don't want to stop by our place? Everyone's coming--
-Why did they arrest Rubens?
I don't know. The military are shooting blind, going after anyone.
Don't give me that, Boca. I was there, in that place. I saw it. I deserve to know what my husband was up to. Don't you think?
I do.

There's no way to just stand by, Eunice. Especially us. We have the means to help. So me, Rubens, Gaspa, Raul, we all do what we can. One talks to the foreign press, another one provides shelter to people on the run, deliver letters to families with no news.
But we're not involved in the armed struggle. Much less Rubens.
So you decided not to say a word to me, to Dalal, to Dalva to protect us.
Of course.
Of course.
And you think Rubens will be released?
I do. He'll be back soon. C'mon, come have dinner with us. Dalal will love to see you.
I'm not really in the mood. Too many kids to raise. Thank you.
...These photos are on the subway. One out front, one inside the train. We were going to a party at the Arraes' house...
Look, are you sure? If you wait till the deed is in order, we can get a much better price.
I've got too much to do. I prefer it this way.
I can loan you money, that's no trouble. That piece of land is a gem, and you can still build the house someday.
Thanks for managing to sell it without the proper papers.
I'm so sorry, Eunice. I wish I could've done more--
-It wasn't your fault.
If you need anything, anything at all, for you or for the kids, just let me know.
